description: This index compares the average tax income per inhabitant of a given administrative unit (e.g. municipality) with the average income per inhabitant in Belgium. For Belgium, this index is assimilated to 100 (Source: Federal Public Service Economy, SMEs, the Self-employed and Energy). If the prosperity index of a given administrative unit exceeds 100, this means that the average income of its inhabitants is higher than the national average income.
name: Prosperity index (Belgian coastal area, 2015)
